abstract: Algeria’s ailing Pres Abdelaziz Bouteflika replaces intelligence chief Mohamed Mediene with his deputy Gen Bachir Tartag; analysts say move, latest security forces shakeup following arrest of former intelligence chief Abdelkader Ait-Ouarabi and removal of other intelligence officials, was done to cement president's position--removing opposition and exerting more civilian control over military.
lead_paragraph: The ousted official, Mohamed Mediene, better known as Toufik, was a powerful figure who headed the intelligence service for 25 years.

headline.main: Algerian President Fires Intelligence Chief in a Shake-Up of Security Forces
headline.print_headline: Algerian President Fires Intelligence Chief in a Shake-Up of Security Forces

snippet: The ousted official, Mohamed Mediene, better known as Toufik, was a powerful figure who headed the intelligence service for 25 years.
